chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kamari J Andrews was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.  Eligible for CIP and SAP.
Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Attend school full time.  Obtain HSED or GED.  No unauthorized tardiness or absences.  No disciplinary actions while in school.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.  Eligible for expungement if 100% compliant with probation, including payment of restitution.

AMENDED ON 9-29-2022: TO ADD RESTITUTION PER STIPULATION AND ORDER.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant is ordered to pay restitution during the term of sentence.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment. To be paid to W.S.

records.addlTxt: for restitution
Does not plan to seek postconviction relief.
Restitution hearing on September 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:55am:  Prosecuting attorney Barry J Braatz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kamari J Andrews in court.  Attorney Gregory A Holdahl in court for Kamari J Andrews. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  The misd. case has been consolidated with these files.  An order has been filed, in Judge Martinez's absence it was signed by Judge Fredrickson.  Parties do not object.  The State's offer is a plea to Ct. 1 in case 21CF1813, recommending 60 days RCJ.  A plea to Cts. 3 and 4 in case 22CF139, recommending 3yr. IC and 3 yr. ES, 3 yr. probation, 120 days RCJ, stayed and restitution request in case 21CM1415.  Parties would be asking for a restitution hearing to be set.  Court performs plea colloquy with the deft.  CC used as a factual basis. Defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters his plea.  Parties are waiving the PSI.  Detective. Timothy Cisler speaks makes statement to the court.  Parties make sentencing arguments.  Court requests sidebar with counsel.  Defendant speaks on his own behalf.  Defense is requesting expungement. 
Plea:

2CF139:
Cts. 1, 2, 5-9- DRI
Ct. 3- GUILTY, 2 yr. WPS, 1 yr. IC and 1 yr. ES.  i/s. 3 yr. probation.   Eligible for CIP and SAP if revoked. 
Ct. 4- GUILTY, 2 yr. WPS, 1 yr. IC and 1 yr. ES.  i/s. 3 yr. probation.  Consecutive to Ct. 3 if revoked.  Eligible for CIP and SAP if revoked.

Conditions:
No alcohol or controlled substances to be monitored by random UA's/breathalyzers.  AODA assessment and any follow through with any recommendations from agent. 
Attend school full time, no unauthorized tardiness or absences.
No disciplinary actions while in school. 
Court Costs.
DNA Sample and Surcharge.
FAW/Vote.
Eligible for Expungement if 100% compliant with probation, including payment of restitution.  

If parties reach a stipulation on restitution the hearing can be removed.

***ALSO $3,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim J.B (person, property, residence or family).  Do not drive at all.  Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments and schooling only.. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail.
NG plea entered.

10:44 AM Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Kamari J Andrews appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Gregory A Holdahl appeared in court for Kamari J Andrews. Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley. 
Defense requests to address bond, it was requested at the last status. Requesting a reduction for slightly lower cash with GPS monitoring with an exception for employment and schooling. 
State Objects to bond modification with argument. 
BTC: Motion to modify bond to $500 cash and $3000 signature bond, adding GPS monitoring with standard exceptions, allowing schooling. 
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
